title: Bug 35156: Ctrl+F1 not working on certain fields in the help search
description: When using Eclipse with a DBCS locale, pressing Ctrl+F1 on the first text field in the help search window does not display the expected help pop up screen. This issue occurs on all DBCS languages. However, when cycling through all the other fields using the tab key, pressing Ctrl+F1 functions properly and displays the correct text. An attachment has been provided to highlight the specific field that is not responding to Ctrl+F1.
OB: Pressing Ctrl+F1 on the first text field in the help search window when using Eclipse with a DBCS locale should display a help pop up screen.
EB: Pressing Ctrl+F1 on the first text field in the help search window when using Eclipse with a DBCS locale does not display the expected help pop up screen.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Launch Eclipse with a DBCS locale.
2. Select 'Search Help' from the menu bar.
3. When the window pops up, click on the first text field and press Ctrl+F1.

Expected Result: A help pop up screen should come up displaying information about the HelpSearch.

Actual Result: Nothing happens.
